Hi,

Got it! Thanks.

One more basic question.

How is unit testing different from component testing.
Let me clarify. Here the component is not something
like COM, but a set of C functions with some exposed
APIs. Testing includes testing these interfaces and
functionality implemented by this component through
these set of C functions.

Currently the way I test these by writing some test
stubs. If it is advantageous to move to cppunit/junit
I would love to do so. Please note that the developer
of these components is not me.

Would appreciate comments/suggestions.

regards,

Jagmohan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> 
wrote:
> Jagmohan S Nanaware wrote:
> > Hi Robert,
> > 
> > Thanks!
> > 
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Robert Wenner <robert@p...> wrote:
> >  > On Monday 14 June 2004 10:26, Jagmohan S Nanaware wrote:
> >  > > Can I test C code using JUnit?
> >  > Yes, using the JNI... but it would be cumbersome.
> >  >
> >  > > Can I use cppunit?
> >  > Yes. That would be less cumbersome.
> >  > Using the right tool may help... funny, isn't it?
> > 
> > Well true. However, what is the right tool for me?
> 
> I think he's saying that CppUnit is the right tool for you. Since 
C code 
> is valid C++ code, I would have to agree.
> -- 
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand
